info.headline: Flood Advisory issued May 29 at 6:10PM EDT until May 29 at 8:00PM EDT by NWS Wilmington NC
info.description:
* WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is possible.
* WHERE...A portion of northeast South Carolina, including the following county, Florence.
* WHEN...Until 800 PM EDT.
* IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Ponding of water in urban or other areas is possible.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 609 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding could begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1 and 3 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain may result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Florence, Timmonsville, Quinby, Francis Marion University, Carolinas Hospital System - Cedar Tower, Carolinas Hospital System, Mcleod Regional Medical Center and Health South Rehabilitation Hospital. - weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.

parameter.value: FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 8 PM EDT THIS EVENING
